conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volumes, and roof/ceiling removed; view is near top-down but still shows wall side faces indicating 3D.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable volumes; cutaway is clean. Camera is only mildly angled (close to orthographic top-down), slightly reducing projection score.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (left twin bedroom, bath, small office, right bedroom, living area, kitchen/dining). Some proportional differences in the central circulation/open area, and window placement/count appears simplified vs the 2D plan; door details are present but not fully verifiable for exact swing/orientation.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture matches expected rooms (beds, office desk, living seating, dining set, kitchen counters/appliances). Bathroom shows tub/sink-like elements, but fixtures appear simplified and toilet/shower detail may not fully match the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable rendering with clear separation of floors/walls/openings; lighting is sufficient and no UI/text contamination. Minor ambiguity from dark flooring reducing contrast with some objects.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: central circulation/open area and some wall spans appear scaled differently than the 2D plan, though adjacency is largely preserved.
Windows are simplified and do not clearly match the 2D plan's window count/locations (not all openings are represented consistently).
Bathroom fixture set is simplified; not all fixtures from the 2D plan are clearly present/identifiable (e.g., toilet/shower specificity).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful room layout and furnishings, with minor proportional drift and simplified/mismatched openings and bathroom detailing.
